meanings.def: an amount of money given to somebody by an organization to help pay for their education
examples: She won a scholarship to study at Stanford.
on a scholarship He went to drama school on a scholarship.
She was awarded a scholarship to Columbia University.
The Fund awards four scholarships every year.
Two of the boys are on football scholarships.

meanings.def: the serious study of an academic subject and the knowledge and methods involved
examples: Oxford became one of the great centres of medieval scholarship.
Her two books maintain the highest standards of scholarship.
He wrote in the tradition of German scholarship.
